en: Smoke from the Chimney Tops 2 Fire settled into the valley, giving Gatlinburg an other worldly appearance. Stephanie Sweeney, noticing raining ash, called the fire Department early in the afternoon,"At this point of time, no active fires are in Gatlinburg." Noticing the thickening smoke, she loaded her two sons, dog and cat, toothbrushes and tax forms. Winds at near hurricane force were knocking down trees. Sweeney followed her instinct to leave and headed to a friends house in Sevierville.

This video examines Marshall Ramsey's artwork "The Smoke Reaches Gatlinburg Valley", which was inspired by the experiences of Stephanie Sweeney during the Chimney Tops 2 Wildfires. Smoke from the wildfires settled into the valley, giving Gatlinburg an other worldly appearance. Sweeney, noticing raining ash, called the fire Department early in the afternoon,"At this point of time, no active fires are in Gatlinburg." Noticing the thickening smoke, she loaded her two sons, dog and cat, toothbrushes and tax forms. Winds at near hurricane force were knocking down trees. Sweeney followed her instinct to leave and headed to a friends house in Sevierville.
